messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] that throat/bronchitis thing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/13/03 2:43:34 PM, hindar@optonline.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/13/03 2:43:34 PM, hindar@... writes:

<< I can't stand this. Sometimes my chest burns, there is this almost soap
like taste in my mouth, my eyes hurt and my bloody ears are so clogged I can
only half hear! Not to mention a cough that won't quit. And I'm ON
anti-biotics...
>>

My husband took anti-biotics and it didn't seem to help. I take NyQuil at
night and I am helped for several hours, which makes me a better nurse for
the rest of the gang in the morning.

Marty and Kirby don't much like drugs so they wanted to tough it out, and
except for Kirby taking DayQuill to go to work and EVERYBODY drinking lots of
cranberry juice and water and eating homemade chicken soup and bread... it
just takes time. Since we had the assortment of treatments and responses,
here, I say do what makes you comfortable while you wait for your body to get
well.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] that throat/bronchitis thing
messages.msgSnippet:
Well thanks for the cheer up ;-)  Actually, if it only last one more week I
think I ll be happy. I can t stand this.  Sometimes my chest burns, there is this
messages.messageBody:
Well thanks for the cheer up ;-) Actually, if it only last one more week I
think I'll be happy.

I can't stand this. Sometimes my chest burns, there is this almost soap
like taste in my mouth, my eyes hurt and my bloody ears are so clogged I can
only half hear! Not to mention a cough that won't quit. And I'm ON
anti-biotics...

GRRRRRRRR
45 and falling apart....

Sorry everyone was ill by you....

be well,
Rachel Ann



-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, February 13, 2003 4:30:46 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] that throat/bronchitis thing

In a message dated 2/13/03 2:21:15 PM, hindar@... writes:

<< writing to you from the land of the sick (I've got brochitis..
somebody tell me this will end soon! I've been sick for three weeks now) >>

Holly had it four weeks. It seems to be everywhere. Kirby and Keith were
REALLY sick for just a few days. Marty's was light. Mine started hard and
lightened up.

If it's the same thing others are having, it could last a month. Sorry.

One thing about air travel is we can ALL have the same colds and flus!

Sandra
